labels.analysis: The MCP Server is designed primarily as a weather forecast service, offering real-time meteorological data by fetching live temperature information based on geographic coordinates. Its core functionality revolves around providing accurate and up-to-date weather data for integration into applications, enhancing decision-making and user experience through weather information.
labels.reasoning: The primary focus on weather data retrieval and forecasting makes the "Weather" predefined category the most appropriate label. The tool provided ("get_live_temp") confirms that the server specializes in weather-related operations, specifically temperature retrieval. Additional secondary labels like "API Integration" are relevant due to the server's emphasis on enabling seamless integration of weather data through a standardized protocol.

tools.name: get_live_temp
tools.description: Get live temperature for a given latitude and longitude.

server_info_crawled.name: Weather Forecast Service
server_info_crawled.author: @hamzaefecarikci/weather-forecast-mcp
server_info_crawled.overview: Provide accurate and up-to-date weather forecasts to enhance your applications with real-time meteorological data. Enable seamless integration of weather information through a standardized protocol for improved decision-making and user experience.

tools.name: get_live_temp
tools.description: Get live temperature for a given latitude and longitude.

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@hamzaefecarikci/weather-forecast-mcp/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
